title: Tex Mex beef
time: Hands on time 10 mins, plus 40 mins cooking time
description: This recipe cooks steak with red onions, cumin, sweet paprika and cocoa powder until it’s tender and sticky. A perfect midweek meal recipe when served with nachos, guacamole and soured cream.
ingredients: 500g topside or rump steak, cut into pieces
1 tbsp chipotle paste (we like Discovery, from Waitrose)
Green chilli, thinly sliced, to serve

method.Step 1: Heat 1 tbsp vegetable oil in a pan and brown the steak then set aside. Heat the remaining oil in a pan and fry the onion wedges, for 5 minutes, until tender.

method.Step 2: Add the ground cumin, sweet smoked paprika and cocoa powder and cook for a further minute, then stir in the tomato purée, chipotle paste and the chicken stock. Season well and simmer for 30 minutes, until sticky and the meat is tender.

method.Step 3: Put in a serving dish, garnish with green chilli and serve with nachos, guacamole, soured cream and grated cheese.
